abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Moldova - Private
            Sector Development Project was satisfactory, the
            sustainability was likely, the institutional development
            impact was high, and the Bank and the borrowers performance
            were both satisfactory. The lessons learned during the
            implementation were that a special bankruptcy program and
            the existing council of creditors on the demand side, had to
            deal with the problem of a large, loss-making former state
            enterprise. There was a market failure on the supply side,
            which was addressed through establishing an agency for
            restructuring assistance as a special agency. It is
            important to build a critical mass of advisors and
            successful managers to firmly establish the new corporate
            culture. Publicizing results and developing effective
            marketing services are important tools to accelerate
            privatization. Making a transition from central planning to
            a market economy and related enterprise reform is an
            enormous task. The process usually involves new laws, and
            changes in patterns of behavior. The Bank provided resources
            for horizontal learning between clients in need of advice
            and advisors who had practical experience of "best
            practice" restructuring in similar transition
            economies. The creation of industrial parks was a successful
            restructuring option enabling internal transformation of
            assets instead of promoting external replacement.
